function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Hard-coded social constructs and periodic routines may not accurately represent real-world behavior, leading to unrealistic simulation outcomes.","Impact":"Inaccurate simulation outcomes may misinform decision-making and policy implementation for disease control.","Mitigation":"Allow for user adaptation of social constructs and periodic routines to better reflect real-world behavior in the simulation.","Technologies":"Flexible parameter set that can be adjusted to represent different communities and countries.","People":"Model developers, policymakers, and public health officials who rely on the simulation outcomes for decision-making and policy implementation.","Owner":"Model developers, policymakers, and public health officials."},{"Description":"Availability of source code and package may lead to unauthorized modifications or misuse of the simulation model.","Impact":"Unauthorized modifications or misuse of the simulation model can lead to unreliable results and misinformed decision-making for disease control.","Mitigation":"Implement strict version control and access restrictions to the source code and package. Provide clear guidelines for authorized use and modification of the model.","Technologies":"Version control systems, access control mechanisms, and clear usage guidelines.","People":"Model developers, authorized researchers, and public health officials.","Owner":"Model developers and authorized researchers."}]}
